thread.title: Arsenal FC news: Arsene Wenger will snub China pay-day to stay among Europe’s elite if he leaves Gunners | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal FC news: Arsene Wenger will snub China pay-day to stay among Europe’s elite if he leaves Gunners | Metro News

author: Metro Sport Reporter For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal FC news: Arsene Wenger will snub China pay-day to stay among Europe’s elite if he leaves Gunners | Metro News
text:
Arsene Wenger will snub China pay-day to stay among Europe’s elite if he leaves Arsenal gossip Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 11:06 pm Arsene Wenger’s future at Arsenal has been the subject of much speculation (Picture: Getty) 
Arsene Wenger will snub a lucrative move to China to stay at a top European club if he leaves Arsenal this summer, according to reports. 
Managerial veteran Wenger is believed to be considering his future following Arsenal’s heavy defeat at Bayern Munich in the Champions League. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
Wenger’s contract at the Emirates expires at the end of the season and the Frenchman has remained coy over his future since the collapse at the Allianz Arena. 
The Daily Mail say the 67-year-old is attracting interest from mega-rich clubs in China and the Middle East, who have been able to secure high-profile managers Manuel Pellegrini and Andre Villas-Boas in recent years. 
However, it is claimed Wenger will reject any advances from China as he would prefer to remain in one of Europe’s top leagues. Gunners boss Wenger reportedly has no interest in going to China (Picture: Getty)
